Note: Participant states “it’s weird” to see the display there.
Participant paired glasses and neural band. Going through tutorials.
Participant states it’s weird getting used to the display.
Participant states in the tutorial there was a screen where the instructions stated to swipe right, but he actually had to swipe left to get to the desired page.
Participant states it’s much easier and clearer when he looks at the dark background of the TV than the light background behind the TV.
Participant states it’s harder to see the pathways in the hypertrail game now that he has moved from the grey couch to the grey chair. He is using the white curtain as a backdrop.
Participant looked downward and began to use the brown table as a background. States this makes it easier.
Participant feels like sometimes it doesn’t catch the finger gestures, then he has to adjust a little bit.
Unable to connect to WhatsApp or Instagram. Had participant toggle on off switch on glasses.
Participant removed glasses for about two seconds while trying to find toggle switch at minute 58.
Participant had issues turning up the volume while on video call. Attempted to use finger gestures, which didn’t work. Then used voice commands to tell Meta to turn up the volume.

Participant was unable to see moderator on the screen for video call. Moderator hung up and called participant back. Participant did not see the call request on the glasses display, but accepted call request on the phone. Now participant is able to see moderator on the glasses screen.
Participant states the call was clear and he could see the moderator well. He could see when the moderator’s eyes moved. States that the audio was good as well after he got it figured out.

Participant states it feels like his eyes are drying out a little bit. States his eyes sometimes dry out when he’s looking at screens a lot, but it depends on the environment. States he turned on the heat in his truck this morning, which probably didn’t help.

Participant asked Meta if the art he’s looking at is famous. States it picked up the picture in the background of what he was looking at before. Participant turned his head more towards the other picture and asked again. At that point, Meta successfully answered his question about the correct picture.
Participant prefers to stay on the couch while asking Meta questions about things around the room.

Participant asked Meta where the picture he is looking at is from - he is sitting on grey couch but facing the wall where pictures of mountains are taped up. When he gets up to stand in front of the image of the mountains, Meta is able to provide an answer about the image.
Participant states Meta won’t give specifics about where the image he’s looking at is. Just states that there is a lake and a mountain.
Participant asked Meta if it could “light that candle for him” but it was still focused on the picture he was looking at before.
Participant states his eyes are getting a little bothered - just dry, not strained.
Participant went to the bathroom around 81 minutes. Just returned at 86 minutes. Kept glasses on.
Participant states he hardly ever wears glasses in real life. Has readers but he doesn’t wear them, just holds the phone further away.
Participant notes less “eye strain” now that he is viewing reels on the phone.
Participant notes that the device “dropped the sound for a couple seconds”, so he wasn’t able to hear the Instagram reels. However, the sound came back on its own.
Participant attempted to turn down sound in order to talk, but states volume kept turning itself up every time he started talking. After a few tries, he was able to keep sound low while talking.
